channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Self-Supervised Modality-Agnostic Pre-Training of Swin Transformers
item.description: Unsupervised pre-training has emerged as a transformative paradigm, displaying remarkable advancements in various domains.

item.title: How Universal Polynomial Bases Enhance Spectral Graph Neural Networks: Heterophily, Over-smoothing, and Over-squashing
item.description: Our extensive experiments, conducted on a diverse range of real-world and synthetic datasets with varying degrees of heterophily, support the superiority of UniFilter.

item.title: AMFD: Distillation via Adaptive Multimodal Fusion for Multispectral Pedestrian Detection
item.description: This increased inference time has hindered the widespread employment of multispectral pedestrian detection in embedded devices for autonomous systems.

item.title: A machine learning framework for interpretable predictions in patient pathways: The case of predicting ICU admission for patients with symptoms of sepsis
item.description: Proactive analysis of patient pathways helps healthcare providers anticipate treatment-related risks, identify outcomes, and allocate resources.

item.title: FFAM: Feature Factorization Activation Map for Explanation of 3D Detectors
item.description: In this paper, we propose a feature factorization activation map (FFAM) to generate high-quality visual explanations for 3D detectors.

item.title: Nearest is Not Dearest: Towards Practical Defense against Quantization-conditioned Backdoor Attacks
item.description: Model quantization is widely used to compress and accelerate deep neural networks.

item.title: Text-Video Retrieval with Global-Local Semantic Consistent Learning
item.description: Then, we devise a shared local interaction module that employs several learnable queries to capture latent semantic concepts for learning fine-grained alignment.

item.title: OLAPH: Improving Factuality in Biomedical Long-form Question Answering
item.description: We highlight that, even on evaluation metrics not used during training, LLMs trained with our OLAPH framework demonstrate significant performance improvement in factuality.

item.title: ProtT3: Protein-to-Text Generation for Text-based Protein Understanding
item.description: ProtT3 empowers an LM to understand protein sequences of amino acids by incorporating a PLM as its protein understanding module, enabling effective protein-to-text generation.

item.title: Can We Treat Noisy Labels as Accurate?
item.description: Instead of focusing on label correction, EchoAlign treats noisy labels ($\tilde{Y}$) as accurate and modifies corresponding instance features ($X$) to achieve better alignment with $\tilde{Y}$.

item.title: The future of cosmological likelihood-based inference: accelerated high-dimensional parameter estimation and model comparison
item.description: Standard nested sampling techniques are simply not feasible in this high-dimensional setting, requiring a projected 12 years of compute time on 48 CPU cores; on the other hand, the proposed approach only requires 8 days of compute time on 24 GPUs.

item.title: Quantifying Emergence in Large Language Models
item.description: Empirical results show that (1) our method gives consistent measurements which align with existing observations based on performance metrics, validating the effectiveness of our emergence quantification; (2) our proposed metric uncovers novel emergence patterns such as the correlations between the variance of our metric and the number of ``shots'' in ICL, which further suggests a new way of interpreting hallucinations in LLMs; (3) we offer a potential solution towards estimating the emergence of larger and closed-resource LMs via smaller LMs like GPT-2.

item.title: SirLLM: Streaming Infinite Retentive LLM
item.description: However, the one-off input of overly long texts is limited, as studies have shown that when input lengths exceed the LLMs' pre-trained text length, there is a dramatic decline in text generation capabilities.

item.title: EPL: Empirical Prototype Learning for Deep Face Recognition
item.description: When the prototypes are updated using the facial sample feature gradients in the model training, they are prone to being pulled away from the class center by the hard samples, resulting in decreased overall model performance.

item.title: Generalize Polyp Segmentation via Inpainting across Diverse Backgrounds and Pseudo-Mask Refinement
item.description: Inpainting lesions within different normal backgrounds is a potential method of addressing the generalization problem, which is crucial for polyp segmentation models.

item.title: PLM4Traj: Cognizing Movement Patterns and Travel Purposes from Trajectories with Pre-trained Language Models
item.description: Secondly, PLM4Traj introduces a novel trajectory prompt that integrates movement patterns and travel purposes into PLMs, while also allowing the model to adapt to various tasks.

item.title: Pytorch-Wildlife: A Collaborative Deep Learning Framework for Conservation
item.description: The Opossum model achieves 98% accuracy, and the Amazon model has 92% recognition accuracy for 36 animals in 90% of the data.

item.title: Comparing Neighbors Together Makes it Easy: Jointly Comparing Multiple Candidates for Efficient and Effective Retrieval
item.description: Moreover, when integrated with another retriever, CMC reranking can function as a virtually enhanced retriever.

item.title: Diffusion-RSCC: Diffusion Probabilistic Model for Change Captioning in Remote Sensing Images
item.description: In training process, we construct a noise predictor conditioned on cross modal features to learn the distribution from the real caption distribution to the standard Gaussian distribution under the Markov chain.

item.title: Retrieval-Augmented Language Model for Extreme Multi-Label Knowledge Graph Link Prediction
item.description: Our experiments demonstrate that (1) KGs with different characteristics require different augmenting strategies, and (2) augmenting the language model's input with textual data improves task performance significantly.

item.title: Large-Scale Multi-Center CT and MRI Segmentation of Pancreas with Deep Learning
item.description: We also collected CT scans of 1, 350 patients from publicly available sources for benchmarking purposes.

item.title: Mammo-CLIP: A Vision Language Foundation Model to Enhance Data Efficiency and Robustness in Mammography
item.description: The lack of large and diverse training data on Computer-Aided Diagnosis (CAD) in breast cancer detection has been one of the concerns that impedes the adoption of the system.

item.title: Feasibility Consistent Representation Learning for Safe Reinforcement Learning
item.description: A key obstacle in this endeavor is the estimation of safety constraints, which is typically more difficult than estimating a reward metric due to the sparse nature of the constraint signals.

item.title: MoRA: High-Rank Updating for Parameter-Efficient Fine-Tuning
item.description: Low-rank adaptation is a popular parameter-efficient fine-tuning method for large language models.

item.title: Fennec: Fine-grained Language Model Evaluation and Correction Extended through Branching and Bridging
item.description: The rapid advancement of large language models has given rise to a plethora of applications across a myriad of real-world tasks, mainly centered on aligning with human intent.

item.title: Modeling User Fatigue for Sequential Recommendation
item.description: In this paper, we propose to model user Fatigue in interest learning for sequential Recommendations (FRec).

item.title: Biomedical Entity Linking for Dutch: Fine-tuning a Self-alignment BERT Model on an Automatically Generated Wikipedia Corpus
item.description: We use MedRoBERTa. nl as base model and perform second-phase pretraining through self-alignment on a Dutch biomedical ontology extracted from the UMLS and Dutch SNOMED.

item.title: Data Contamination Calibration for Black-box LLMs
item.description: The rapid advancements of Large Language Models (LLMs) tightly associate with the expansion of the training data size.

item.title: Sheet Music Transformer ++: End-to-End Full-Page Optical Music Recognition for Pianoform Sheet Music
item.description: In this work, we present the Sheet Music Transformer++, an end-to-end model that is able to transcribe full-page polyphonic music scores without the need of a previous Layout Analysis step.

item.title: PULL: PU-Learning-based Accurate Link Prediction
item.description: Given an edge-incomplete graph, how can we accurately find the missing links?

item.title: PT43D: A Probabilistic Transformer for Generating 3D Shapes from Single Highly-Ambiguous RGB Images
item.description: Experiments demonstrate that our model outperforms state of the art in both scenarios

item.title: QComp: A QSAR-Based Data Completion Framework for Drug Discovery
item.description: In drug discovery, in vitro and in vivo experiments reveal biochemical activities related to the efficacy and toxicity of compounds.

item.title: Modeling citation worthiness by using attention-based bidirectional long short-term memory networks and interpretable models
item.description: This opens the door for our model to check documents during pre-submission and pre-archival procedures.

item.title: Training Data Attribution via Approximate Unrolled Differentiation
item.description: While being computationally efficient compared to unrolling-based approaches, Source is suitable in cases where implicit-differentiation-based approaches struggle, such as in non-converged models and multi-stage training pipelines.

item.title: Imp: Highly Capable Large Multimodal Models for Mobile Devices
item.description: By harnessing the capabilities of large language models (LLMs), recent large multimodal models (LMMs) have shown remarkable versatility in open-world multimodal understanding.

item.title: Highway Graph to Accelerate Reinforcement Learning
item.description: We focus on improving the training efficiency of RL algorithms by improving the efficiency of the value learning process.

item.title: MathBench: Evaluating the Theory and Application Proficiency of LLMs with a Hierarchical Mathematics Benchmark
item.description: MathBench spans a wide range of mathematical disciplines, offering a detailed evaluation of both theoretical understanding and practical problem-solving skills.

item.title: Mamba-in-Mamba: Centralized Mamba-Cross-Scan in Tokenized Mamba Model for Hyperspectral Image Classification
item.description: Hyperspectral image (HSI) classification is pivotal in the remote sensing (RS) field, particularly with the advancement of deep learning techniques.

item.title: ASMR: Activation-sharing Multi-resolution Coordinate Networks For Efficient Inference
item.description: Coordinate network or implicit neural representation (INR) is a fast-emerging method for encoding natural signals (such as images and videos) with the benefits of a compact neural representation.

item.title: Foundation Model for Chemical Process Modeling: Meta-Learning with Physics-Informed Adaptation
item.description: In this work, we introduce a novel application of foundation models in the domain of nonlinear chemical process modeling.

item.title: Adapting Large Multimodal Models to Distribution Shifts: The Role of In-Context Learning
item.description: We find that the success of ICL heavily relies on the choice of demonstration, mirroring challenges seen in large language models but introducing unique complexities for LMMs facing distribution shifts.

item.title: EPPS: Advanced Polyp Segmentation via Edge Information Injection and Selective Feature Decoupling
item.description: Furthermore, we introduce a component called Selective Feature Decoupler (SFD) to suppress the influence of noise and extraneous features on the model.

item.title: Evaluating and Modeling Social Intelligence: A Comparative Study of Human and AI Capabilities
item.description: Facing the current debate on whether Large Language Models (LLMs) attain near-human intelligence levels (Mitchell & Krakauer, 2023; Bubeck et al., 2023; Kosinski, 2023; Shiffrin & Mitchell, 2023; Ullman, 2023), the current study introduces a benchmark for evaluating social intelligence, one of the most distinctive aspects of human cognition.

item.title: AutoSoccerPose: Automated 3D posture Analysis of Soccer Shot Movements
item.description: The dataset, code, and models are available at: https://github. com/calvinyeungck/3D-Shot-Posture-Dataset.

item.title: Multiple-Choice Questions are Efficient and Robust LLM Evaluators
item.description: We present GSM-MC and MATH-MC, two multiple-choice (MC) datasets constructed by collecting answers and incorrect predictions on GSM8K and MATH from over 50 open-source models.

item.title: CaseGNN++: Graph Contrastive Learning for Legal Case Retrieval with Graph Augmentation
item.description: Specifically, an edge feature-based graph attention layer (EUGAT) is proposed to comprehensively update node and edge features during graph modelling, resulting in a full utilisation of structural information of legal cases.

item.title: Learning Spatial Similarity Distribution for Few-shot Object Counting
item.description: To address this issue, we propose a network learning Spatial Similarity Distribution (SSD) for few-shot object counting, which preserves the spatial structure of exemplar features and calculates a 4D similarity pyramid point-to-point between the query features and exemplar features, capturing the complete distribution information for each point in the 4D similarity space.

item.title: PATE: Proximity-Aware Time series anomaly Evaluation
item.description: We introduce Proximity-Aware Time series anomaly Evaluation (PATE), a novel evaluation metric that incorporates the temporal relationship between prediction and anomaly intervals.

item.title: Configurable Mirror Descent: Towards a Unification of Decision Making
item.description: Decision-making problems, categorized as single-agent, e. g., Atari, cooperative multi-agent, e. g., Hanabi, competitive multi-agent, e. g., Hold'em poker, and mixed cooperative and competitive, e. g., football, are ubiquitous in the real world.

item.title: Enhancing Explainable AI: A Hybrid Approach Combining GradCAM and LRP for CNN Interpretability
item.description: We present a new technique that explains the output of a CNN-based model using a combination of GradCAM and LRP methods.
